intro: Argostemma squalens, commonly known as the slender argostemma, is a herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a hairy surface and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release tiny seeds when mature. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
